description: Erection of a single storey rear infill extension and rear and side roof dormer extensions, installation of one front roof light, removal of the existing front porch, installation of a replacement front door and new front window to the house and replacement of all front windows. New boundary wall and shutter doors to the rear.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [TR-R00-EX-002; TR-R00-EX-003; TR-R00-EX-004; Received: 01/02/2024; TR-R01-PR-001; TR-R01-PR-002; TR-R01-PR-004; TR-R01-PR-005; TR-R01-PR-101; Received: 28/06/2024; TR-R01-PR-003; Received 02/07/2024.].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows, doors or other glazed openings shall be formed in the single storey rear infill extension, rear roof dormer extension and side roof dormer extension hereby approved.  
Reasons:  To protect the character and appearance of the Conservation Area and neighbour living conditions.

Condition : 5 - Window located in a side dormer of the dwellinghouse must be: (a) obscure-glazed; and (b) non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room. Any such windows shall, once installed, be retained permanently as such, and once built no further side windows shall be installed. 

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and the appearance of the area.
